edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.gnsapp.activegns

Class ActiveGNSClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gnsclient.client.GNSClient
      • edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.gnsapp.activegns.ActiveGNSClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActiveDBInterface

    public class ActiveGNSClient
extends GNSClient
implements ActiveDBInterface
    Author:
    arun This client is designed to be used either by an active request worker process or by the main GNS process to issue read or write requests to the GNS on behalf of active request JS. This implementation is agnostic to whether the GUID being queried resides on the same machine or a remote machine.

      Refer GNSClient.GNSClient().

      GNSCommand execute(CommandPacket commandPacket)
      Overrides GNSClient.execute(CommandPacket) with internal request checks that can only be determined with a GNSClient instance, e.g, dynamically force-coordinated read requests.

      Refer ActiveDBInterface.read(InternalRequestHeader, String, String) for implementation guidelines

      This method returns the value of targetGUID.field and is meant to be used by the worker process encapsulating the active code script engine.

      • read

        public JSONObject read(InternalRequestHeader header,
                       String targetGUID,
                       String field)
                throws ClientException,
                       InternalRequestException
        Description copied from interface: ActiveDBInterface
        This method returns the value of targetGUID.field and is meant to be used by the worker process encapsulating the active code script engine. This method can be used to read the entire GUID record (subject to ACL checks) by specifying field as GNSCommandProtocol.ALL_FIELDS. The implementer is expected to implement this method and others in this class using ActiveGNSClient and GNSCommandInternal.fieldRead(String, String, InternalRequestHeader) to construct and send server-internal commands with querierGUID set to the originating GUID for the active request chain being processed. A ClientException means that the implementer may (optionally) retry the request but an InternalRequestException must be treated as an error and it is the implementer's responsibility to ensure that it is thrown in the thread invoking GNSApp.execute(edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.interfaces.Request, boolean) .
        Specified by:
        read in interface ActiveDBInterface
        Parameters:
        header - The header information for the current active active request in the chain.
        targetGUID - The queried GUID.
        field - The queried field.
        Returns:
        JSONObject representation of guid.field.
        Throws:
        ClientException
        InternalRequestException

      • execute

        public GNSCommand execute(CommandPacket commandPacket)
                   throws IOException,
                          ClientException
        Overrides GNSClient.execute(CommandPacket) with internal request checks that can only be determined with a GNSClient instance, e.g, dynamically force-coordinated read requests.
        Overrides:
        execute in class GNSClient
        Returns:
        GNSCommand after execution containing the result if any.
        Throws:
        IOException
        ClientException
